Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.core

Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.ontology.data

package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.ontology.data
Data structures for generic representation of ontologies.

The API has been designed around the following principles:

  • The API should follow the principle of least surprise, i.e., offer consistency.
  • Redundancies should be kept to a minimum, in some places, it is possible functions are offered for obtaining Collection or a Iterator, depending on the user's requirements.
  • The API deals with TermIds on the graph level. These are then linked to more richly attributed Terms through Maps.
  • The central classes offer relatively minimal interfaces, decorator classes are used for providing more extended behaviour.
  • Even more complex behaviour is available in the org.monarchinitiative.phenol.ontology.algo package in a one-class-per-algorithm fashion, similar to the separation between graph data structures and graph algorithms.
Author:
Manuel Holtgrewe

    Interface for ontologies without the all-ancestor-related convenience functions.

    Interface for most ontology implementations to implement.
    Relationship
    A class that encapsulates the edge type in the ontology graph.
    RelationshipType
    Enumeration for describing relation qualifiers (forked from GoRelationQualifer in Ontolib).
    SimpleXref
    Class to represent the database_cross_reference such as "PMID:102212" or "HPO:skoehler" that is used to represent the provenance of the Term definitions in the HPO.
    SynonymType
    An enumeration of the possible synonym types (note: most synonyms in the current HPO do not have a specific type; we encode these as NONE.
    Term
    Representation of an OBO term (forked and modified from GoTerm)
    Term.Builder
     
    TermAnnotation
    A TermAnnotation links a TermId to TermId of a "world object".

    Helper class with static convenience functions.
    TermId
    Immutable TermId.

    Helper class with static utility methods on term ids.

    Interface for implementation of the visitor pattern for ontology terms (identified by their TermId).

    Immutable implementation of TermXref.
    Versioned
    Implementors have an optional version.
